member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.BaseSteamworks
member.summary: Implements shared functionality between Steamworks.Client and Steamworks.Server

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.BaseSteamworks.AppId
member.summary: Current running program's AppId

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.BaseSteamworks.IsValid
member.summary: Returns true if this instance has initialized properly. If this returns false you should Dispose and throw an error.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.BaseSteamworks.RunUpdateCallbacks
member.summary: This gets called automatically in Update. Only call it manually if you know why you're doing it.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.BaseSteamworks.UpdateWhile(System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Run Update until func returns false. This will cause your program to lock up until it finishes. This is useful for things like tests or command line utilities etc.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.Instance
member.summary: A singleton accessor to get the current client instance.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.Username
member.summary: Current user's Username

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.SteamId
member.summary: Current user's SteamId

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.OwnerSteamId
member.summary: If we're sharing this game, this is the owner of it.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.BetaName
member.summary: Current Beta name, if we're using a beta branch.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.BuildId
member.summary: The BuildId of the current build

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.InstallFolder
member.summary: The folder in which this app is installed

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.CurrentLanguage
member.summary: The currently selected language

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.AvailableLanguages
member.summary: List of languages available to the game

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.Update
member.summary: Should be called at least once every frame

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.RunCallbacks
member.summary: This is called in Update() - there's no need to call it manually unless you're running your own Update

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.Dispose
member.summary: Call when finished to shut down the Steam client.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.IsSubscribed
member.summary: True if we're subscribed/authorised to be running this app

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.IsCybercafe
member.summary: True if we're a cybercafe account

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.IsSubscribedFromFreeWeekend
member.summary: True if we're subscribed/authorised to be running this app, but only temporarily due to a free weekend etc.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.IsLowViolence
member.summary: True if we're in low violence mode (germans are only allowed to see the insides of bodies in porn)

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Client.RestartIfNecessary(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Checks if your executable was launched through Steam and relaunches it through Steam if it wasn't. If this returns true then it starts the Steam client if required and launches your game again through it, and you should quit your process as soon as possible. This effectively runs steam://run/AppId so it may not relaunch the exact executable that called it, as it will always relaunch from the version installed in your Steam library folder. If it returns false, then your game was launched by the Steam client and no action needs to be taken. One exception is if a steam_appid.txt file is present then this will return false regardless. This allows you to develop and test without launching your game through the Steam client. Make sure to remove the steam_appid.txt file when uploading the game to your Steam depot!

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Achievements.Find(System.String)
member.summary: Find an achievement by name. Will be null if not found, or not ready.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Achievements.Trigger(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unlock an achievement by identifier. If apply is true this will happen as expected and the achievement overlay will popup etc. If it's false then you'll have to manually call Stats.StoreStats() to actually trigger it.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Achievements.Reset(System.String)
member.summary: Reset an achievement by identifier

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Achievement.State
member.summary: True if unlocked

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Achievement.UnlockTime
member.summary: Should hold the unlock time if State is true

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Achievement.GlobalUnlockedPercentage
member.summary: Returns the percentage of users who have unlocked the specified achievement, or -1 if no data available.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Achievement.Trigger(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Make this achievement earned

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Achievement.Reset
member.summary: Reset this achievement to not achieved

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Achievement.Refresh
member.summary: Refresh the unlock state. You shouldn't need to call this manually but it's here if you have to for some reason. Retuns true if state changed (meaning, probably unlocked)

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.App.MarkContentCorrupt(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Mark the content as corrupt, so it will validate the downloaded files once the app is closed. This is good to call when you detect a crash happening or a file is missing that is meant to be there.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.App.InstallDlc(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Tell steam to install the Dlc specified by the AppId

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.App.UninstallDlc(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Tell steam to uninstall the Dlc specified by the AppId

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.App.PurchaseTime(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Get the purchase time for this appid. Will return DateTime.MinValue if none.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.App.IsSubscribed(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Checks if the active user is subscribed to a specified AppId. Only use this if you need to check ownership of another game related to yours, a demo for example.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.App.IsInstalled(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns true if specified app is installed.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Auth.Ticket.Cancel

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Auth.GetAuthSessionTicket

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Leaderboard.AddScore(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Add a score to this leaderboard. Subscores are totally optional, and can be used for other game defined data such as laps etc.. although they have no bearing on sorting at all If onlyIfBeatsOldScore is true, the score will only be updated if it beats the existing score, else it will always be updated. Beating the existing score is subjective - and depends on how your leaderboard was set up as to whether that means higher or lower.

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.Leaderboard.AddScoreCallback
member.summary: Callback invoked by when score submission is complete.
member.param: If successful, information about the new entry

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.Leaderboard.AddScoreResult
member.summary: Information about a newly submitted score.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Leaderboard.AddScore(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32[],Facepunch.Steamworks.Leaderboard.AddScoreCallback,Facepunch.Steamworks.Callbacks.FailureCallback)
member.summary: Add a score to this leaderboard. Subscores are totally optional, and can be used for other game defined data such as laps etc.. although they have no bearing on sorting at all If onlyIfBeatsOldScore is true, the score will only be updated if it beats the existing score, else it will always be updated. Information about the newly submitted score is passed to the optional .

The maximum amount of people you want to be able to be in this lobby, including yourself

String key of the type of data you want to get

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Lobby.UpdateLobbyData
member.summary: Updates the LobbyData property to have the data for the current lobby, if any

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Lobby.OnLobbyDataUpdated
member.summary: Called when the lobby data itself has been updated. Called when someone has joined/left, Owner has updated data, etc.

member.summary: Called when a member of the lobby has updated either their personal Lobby metadata or someone's global steam state has changed (like a display name). Parameter is the user who changed.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Lobby.OnChatMessageRecieved
member.summary: Callback to get chat messages. Use Encoding.UTF8.GetString to retrive the message.

member.summary: Like OnChatMessageRecieved but the data is converted to a string

member.summary: Broadcasts a chat message to the all the users in the lobby users in the lobby (including the local user) will receive a LobbyChatMsg_t callback.
member.returns: True if message successfully sent

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.Lobby.MemberStateChange
member.summary: Enums to catch the state of a user when their state has changed

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Lobby.OnLobbyStateChanged
member.summary: Called when the state of the Lobby is somehow shifted. Usually when someone joins or leaves the lobby. The first ulong is the SteamID of the user that initiated the change. The second ulong is the person that was affected

member.summary: Remove this file from remote storage, while keeping a local copy. Writing to this file again will re-add it to the cloud.

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.RemoteFileWriteStream
member.summary: Stream used to write to a .

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.RemoteFileWriteStream.Cancel
member.summary: Close the stream without saving the file to remote storage.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Custom(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Query a list of addresses. No filters applied.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.History(Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Filter)
member.summary: Request a list of servers we've been on. History isn't applied automatically You need to call server.AddtoHistoryList() when you join a server etc.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Favourites(Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Filter)
member.summary: Request a list of servers we've favourited

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Friends(Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Filter)
member.summary: Request a list of servers that our friends are on

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Local(Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Filter)
member.summary: Request a list of servers that are running on our LAN

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Request.Responded
member.summary: A list of servers that responded. If you're only interested in servers that responded since you last updated, then simply clear this list.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Request.Unresponsive
member.summary: A list of servers that were in the master list but didn't respond.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Request.Finished
member.summary: True when we have finished

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Request.Dispose

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Server.Favourite
member.summary: Returns true if this server is in the favourites list

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Server.Rules

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Server.HasRules

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Server.FetchRules

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Server.AddToHistory
member.summary: Add this server to our history list If we're already in the history list, weill set the last played time to now

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Server.RemoveFromHistory

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Server.AddToFavourites
member.summary: Add this server to our favourite list

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerList.Server.RemoveFromFavourites

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Stats.Set(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set a stat value. This will automatically call StoreStats() after a successful call unless you pass false as the last argument.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Stats.Set(System.String,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set a stat value. This will automatically call StoreStats() after a successful call unless you pass false as the last argument.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Stats.Add(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds this amount to the named stat. Internally this calls Get() and adds to that value. Steam doesn't provide a mechanism for atomically increasing stats like this, this functionality is added here as a convenience.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Stats.ResetAll(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Practically wipes the slate clean for this user. If includeAchievements is true, will wipe any achievements too.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Voice.OptimalSampleRate
member.summary: Returns the optimal sample rate for voice - according to Steam

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Voice.WantsRecording
member.summary: If set to true we are listening to the mic. You should usually toggle this with the press of a key for push to talk.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Voice.LastVoiceRecordTime
member.summary: The last time voice was detected, recorded

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Voice.DesiredSampleRate
member.summary: If set we will capture the audio at this rate. If unset (set to 0) will capture at OptimalSampleRate

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Voice.Update
member.summary: This gets called inside Update - so there's no need to call this manually if you're calling update

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Config.ForUnity(System.String)
member.summary: Should be called before creating any interfaces, to configure Steam for Unity.
member.param: Please pass in Application.platform.ToString()

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Config.UseThisCall
member.summary:
Some platforms allow/need CallingConvention.ThisCall. If you're crashing with argument null errors on certain platforms, try flipping this to true.
I owe this logic to Riley Labrecque's hard work on Steamworks.net - I don't have the knowledge or patience to find this shit on my own, so massive thanks to him. And also massive thanks to him for releasing his shit open source under the MIT license so we can all learn and iterate.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Config.ForcePlatform(Facepunch.Steamworks.OperatingSystem,Facepunch.Steamworks.Architecture)
member.summary: You can force the platform to a particular one here. This is useful if you're on OSX because some versions of mono don't have a way to tell which platform we're running

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.OnUpdate
member.summary: Called when the local client's items are first retrieved, and when they change. Obviously not called on the server.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Items
member.summary: A list of items owned by this user. You should call Refresh() before trying to access this, and then wait until it's non null or listen to OnUpdate to find out immediately when it's populated.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.SerializedItems
member.summary: You can send this data to a server, or another player who can then deserialize it and get a verified list of items.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.SerializedExpireTime
member.summary: Serialized data exprires after an hour. This is the time the value in SerializedItems will expire.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.onFullUpdate(SteamNative.SteamInventoryFullUpdate_t,System.Boolean)
member.summary: We've received a FULL update

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.onResultReady(SteamNative.SteamInventoryResultReady_t,System.Boolean)
member.summary: A generic result has returned.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.ApplyResult(Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Result)
member.summary: Apply this result to our current stack of Items Here we're trying to keep our stack up to date with whatever happens with the crafting, stacking etc

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.PlaytimeHeartbeat
member.summary: Call this at least every two minutes, every frame doesn't hurt. You should call it when you consider it active play time. IE - your player is alive, and playing. Don't stress on it too much tho cuz it's super hijackable anyway.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Refresh
member.summary: Call this to retrieve the items. Note that if this has already been called it won't trigger a call to OnUpdate unless the items have changed

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.CreateDefinition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Some definitions aren't sent to the client, and all aren't available on the server. Manually getting a Definition here lets you call functions on those definitions.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Update
member.summary: No need to call this manually if you're calling Update

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definitions
member.summary: A list of items defined for this app. This should be immediately populated and available.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.PriceCategoryToFloat(System.String)
member.summary: Utility, given a "1;VLV250" string, convert it to a 2.5

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.FindDefinition(System.Int32)
member.summary: You really need me to explain what this does? Use your brains.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.CraftItem(Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Item[],Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition)
member.summary: Crafting! Uses the passed items to buy the target item. You need to have set up the appropriate exchange rules in your item definitions. This assumes all the items passed in aren't stacked.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.CraftItem(Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Item.Amount[],Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition)
member.summary: Crafting! Uses the passed items to buy the target item. You need to have set up the appropriate exchange rules in your item definitions.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.SplitStack(Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Item,System.Int32)
member.summary: Split stack into two items

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Stack(Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Item,Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Item,System.Int32)
member.summary: Stack source item onto dest item

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.GenerateItem(Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is used to grant a specific item to the user. This should only be used for development prototyping, from a trusted server, or if you don't care about hacked clients granting arbitrary items. This call can be disabled by a setting on Steamworks.

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition
member.summary: An item definition. This describes an item in your Steam inventory, but is not unique to that item. For example, this might be a tshirt, but you might be able to own multiple tshirts.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition.IconUrl
member.summary: URL to an image specified by the schema, else empty

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition.IconLargeUrl
member.summary: URL to an image specified by the schema, else empty

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition.Type
member.summary: Type can be whatever the schema defines.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition.ExchangeSchema
member.summary: If this item can be created using other items this string will contain a comma seperated list of definition ids that can be used, ie "100,101;102x5;103x3,104x3"

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition.Recipes
member.summary: A list of recepies for creating this item. Can be null if none.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition.IngredientFor
member.summary: A list of recepies we're included in

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition.PriceRaw
member.summary: The raw contets of price_category from the schema

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition.PriceDollars

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition.Marketable
member.summary: Returns true if this item can be sold on the marketplace

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition.SetProperty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: If you're manually occupying the Definition (because maybe you're on a server and want to hack around the fact that definitions aren't presented to you), you can use this to set propertis.

member.summary: Read a raw property from the definition schema

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Definition.TriggerItemDrop
member.summary: Trigger an item drop. Call this when it's a good time to award an item drop to a player. This won't automatically result in giving an item to a player. Just call it every minute or so, or on launch. ItemDefinition is usually a generator

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Recipe
member.summary: Represents a crafting recepie which was defined using the exchange section in the item schema.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Recipe.Ingredient.DefinitionId
member.summary: The definition ID of the ingredient.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Recipe.Ingredient.Definition

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Recipe.Ingredient.Count
member.summary: The amount of this item needed. Generally this will be 1.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Recipe.Result
member.summary: The item that this will create.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Recipe.Ingredients
member.summary: The items, with quantity required to create this item.

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Item
member.summary: An item in your inventory.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Item.Definition
member.summary: Careful, this might not be available. Especially on a game server.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Result.OnResult
member.summary: Called when result is successfully returned

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Result.Items
member.summary: Items that exist, or that have been created, or changed

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Result.Removed
member.summary: Items that have been removed or somehow destroyed

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Result.Consumed
member.summary: Items that have been consumed, like in a craft or something

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Inventory.Result.IsPending

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Networking.Update
member.summary: No need to call this manually if you're calling Update()

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Networking.SetListenChannel(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable listening on a specific channel. If you donp't enable the channel we won't listen to it, so you won't be able to receive messages on it.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Networking.SendType.Unreliable
member.summary: Basic UDP send. Packets can't be bigger than 1200 bytes (your typical MTU size). Can be lost, or arrive out of order (rare). The sending API does have some knowledge of the underlying connection, so if there is no NAT-traversal accomplished or there is a recognized adjustment happening on the connection, the packet will be batched until the connection is open again.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Networking.SendType.UnreliableNoDelay
member.summary: As above, but if the underlying p2p connection isn't yet established the packet will just be thrown away. Using this on the first packet sent to a remote host almost guarantees the packet will be dropped. This is only really useful for kinds of data that should never buffer up, i.e. voice payload packets

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Networking.SendType.Reliable
member.summary: Reliable message send. Can send up to 1MB of data in a single message. Does fragmentation/re-assembly of messages under the hood, as well as a sliding window for efficient sends of large chunks of data.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Networking.SendType.ReliableWithBuffering
member.summary: As above, but applies the Nagle algorithm to the send - sends will accumulate until the current MTU size (typically ~1200 bytes, but can change) or ~200ms has passed (Nagle algorithm). Useful if you want to send a set of smaller messages but have the coalesced into a single packet Since the reliable stream is all ordered, you can do several small message sends with k_EP2PSendReliableWithBuffering and then do a normal k_EP2PSendReliable to force all the buffered data to be sent.

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop
member.summary:
Allows you to interact with Steam's UGC stuff (User Generated Content). To put simply, this allows you to upload a folder of files to Steam.
To upload a new file use CreateItem. This returns an Editor object. This object is also used to edit existing items.
To get a list of items you can call CreateQuery. From there you can download an item and retrieve the folder that it's downloaded to.
Generally there's no need to compress and decompress your uploads, so you should usually be able to use the content straight from the destination folder.

member.name: E:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.OnFileDownloaded
member.summary: Called when an item has been downloaded. This could have been because of a call to Download.

member.name: E:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.OnItemInstalled
member.summary: Called when an item has been installed. This could have been because of a call to Download or because of a subscription triggered via the browser/app.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.Dispose
member.summary: You should never have to call this manually

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.CreateQuery
member.summary:
Creates a query object, which is used to get a list of items.
This could be a list of the most popular items, or a search, or just getting a list of the items you've uploaded.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.CreateItem(Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.ItemType)
member.summary: Create a new Editor object with the intention of creating a new item. Your item won't actually be created until you call Publish() on the object.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.CreateItem(System.UInt32,Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.ItemType)
member.summary: Create a new Editor object with the intention of creating a new item. Your item won't actually be created until you call Publish() on the object. Your item will be published to the provided appId.
member.remarks: You need to add app publish permissions for cross app uploading to work.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.EditItem(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Returns a class representing this ItemId. We don't query item name, description etc. We don't verify that item exists. We don't verify that this item belongs to your app.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.GetItem(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Gets an Item object for a specific item. This doesn't currently query the item's name and description. It's only really useful if you know an item's ID and want to download it, or check its current download status.

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.Order
member.summary: How a query should be ordered.

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.QueryType
member.summary: The type of item you are querying for

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.QueryType.Items
member.summary: Both MicrotransactionItems and subscriptionItems

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.QueryType.MicrotransactionItems
member.summary: Workshop item that is meant to be voted on for the purpose of selling in-game

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.QueryType.SubscriptionItems
member.summary: normal Workshop item that can be subscribed to

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.ItemType
member.summary: Used to define the item type when creating

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.UserQueryType
member.summary: When querying a specific user's items this defines what type of items you're looking for.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.Item.Url
member.summary: Return a URL to view this item online

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.Query.AppId
member.summary: The AppId you're querying. This defaults to this appid.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.Query.UploaderAppId
member.summary: The AppId of the app used to upload the item. This defaults to 0 which means all/any.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.Query.RankedByTrendDays
member.summary: If order is RankedByTrend, this value represents how many days to take into account.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.Query.OnResult
member.summary: Called when the query finishes

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.Query.Page
member.summary: Page starts at 1 !!

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.Query.RequireTags
member.summary: Only return items with these tags

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.Query.RequireAllTags
member.summary: If true, return items that have all RequireTags If false, return items that have any tags in RequireTags

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Workshop.Query.ExcludeTags
member.summary: Don't return any items with this tag

member.summary: If you're querying for a particular file or files, add them to this.

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server
member.summary:
Initialize this class for Game Servers.
Game servers offer a limited amount of Steam functionality - and don't require the Steam client.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.Instance
member.summary: A singleton accessor to get the current client instance.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.#ctor(System.UInt32,Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerInit)
member.summary: Initialize a Steam Server instance

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.Update
member.summary: Should be called at least once every frame

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.DedicatedServer
member.summary: Sets whether this should be marked as a dedicated server. If not, it is assumed to be a listen server.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.MaxPlayers
member.summary: Gets or sets the current MaxPlayers. This doesn't enforce any kind of limit, it just updates the master server.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.BotCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the current BotCount. This doesn't enforce any kind of limit, it just updates the master server.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.MapName
member.summary: Gets or sets the current Map Name.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.ModDir
member.summary: Gets or sets the current ModDir

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.Product
member.summary: Gets the current product

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.GameDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets the current Product

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.ServerName
member.summary: Gets or sets the current ServerName

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.Passworded
member.summary: Set whether the server should report itself as passworded

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.GameTags
member.summary: Gets or sets the current GameTags. This is a comma seperated list of tags for this server. When querying the server list you can filter by these tags.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.LogOnAnonymous
member.summary: Log onto Steam anonymously.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.LoggedOn
member.summary: Returns true if the server is connected and registered with the Steam master server You should have called LogOnAnonymous etc on startup.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.SetKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Sets a Key Value. These can be anything you like, and are accessible when querying servers from the server list.
Information describing gamemodes are common here.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.UpdatePlayer(System.UInt64,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Update this connected player's information. You should really call this any time a player's name or score changes. This keeps the information shown to server queries up to date.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.Dispose
member.summary: Shutdown interface, disconnect from Steam

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.PublicIp
member.summary: To the best of its ability this tries to get the server's current public ip address. Be aware that this is likely to return null for the first few seconds after initialization.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.AutomaticHeartbeats
member.summary: Enable or disable heartbeats, which are sent regularly to the master server. Enabled by default.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.AutomaticHeartbeatRate
member.summary: Set heartbeat interval, if automatic heartbeats are enabled. You can leave this at the default.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Server.ForceHeartbeat
member.summary: Force send a heartbeat to the master server instead of waiting for the next automatic update (if you've left them enabled)

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerAuth.OnAuthChange
member.summary: Steamid, Ownerid, Status

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerAuth.Status
member.summary: Steam authetication statuses

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerAuth.StartSession(System.Byte[],System.UInt64)
member.summary: Start authorizing a ticket. This user isn't authorized yet. Wait for a call to OnAuthChange.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerAuth.EndSession(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Forget this guy. They're no longer in the game.

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerQuery
member.summary: If you're manually processing the server queries, you should use this class.

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerQuery.Packet
member.summary: A server query packet.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerQuery.Packet.Address
member.summary: Target IP address

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerQuery.Packet.Port
member.summary: Target port

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerQuery.Packet.Data
member.summary: This data is pooled. Make a copy if you don't use it immediately. This buffer is also quite large - so pay attention to Size.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerQuery.Packet.Size
member.summary: Size of the data

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerQuery.GetOutgoingPacket(Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerQuery.Packet@)
member.summary: If true, Steam wants to send a packet. You should respond by sending this packet in an unconnected way to the returned Address and Port.
member.param: Packet to send. The Data passed is pooled - so use it immediately.
member.returns: True if we want to send a packet

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerQuery.Handle(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.UInt32,System.UInt16)
member.summary: We have received a server query on our game port. Pass it to Steam to handle.

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerInit
member.summary: Used to set up the server. The variables in here are all required to be set, and can't be changed once the server is created.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerInit.VersionString
member.summary: The version string is usually in the form x.x.x.x, and is used by the master server to detect when the server is out of date. If you go into the dedicated server tab on steamworks you'll be able to server the latest version. If this version number is less than that latest version then your server won't show.

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerInit.ModDir
member.summary: This should be the same directory game where gets installed into. Just the folder name, not the whole path. I.e. "Rust", "Garrysmod".

member.name: F:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerInit.GameDescription
member.summary: The game description. Setting this to the full name of your game is recommended.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerInit.RandomSteamPort
member.summary: Set the Steam quert port

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerInit.QueryShareGamePort
member.summary:
If you pass MASTERSERVERUPDATERPORT_USEGAMESOCKETSHARE into usQueryPort, then it causes the game server API to use "GameSocketShare" mode, which means that the game is responsible for sending and receiving UDP packets for the master server updater.
More info about this here: https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamGameServer#HandleIncomingPacket

member.name: T:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerStats
member.summary: Allows getting and setting stats on users from the gameserver. These stats should have been set up on the Steamworks website for your app.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerStats.Refresh(System.UInt64,System.Action{System.UInt64,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Retrieve the stats for this user. If you pass a callback function in this will be called when the stats are recieved, the bool will signify whether it was successful or not.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerStats.Commit(System.UInt64,System.Action{System.UInt64,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Once you've set a stat change on a user you need to commit your changes. You can do that using this function. The callback will let you know if your action succeeded, but most of the time you can fire and forget.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerStats.SetInt(System.UInt64,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the named stat for this user. Setting stats should follow the rules you defined in Steamworks.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerStats.SetFloat(System.UInt64,System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the named stat for this user. Setting stats should follow the rules you defined in Steamworks.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerStats.GetInt(System.UInt64,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the named stat for this user. If getting the stat failed, will return defaultValue. You should have called Refresh for this userid - which downloads the stats from the backend. If you didn't call it this will always return defaultValue.

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.ServerStats.GetFloat(System.UInt64,System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Get the named stat for this user. If getting the stat failed, will return defaultValue. You should have called Refresh for this userid - which downloads the stats from the backend. If you didn't call it this will always return defaultValue.

member.name: P:Facepunch.Steamworks.Utility.Epoch.Current
member.summary: Returns the current Unix Epoch

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Utility.Epoch.ToDateTime(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Convert an epoch to a datetime

member.name: M:Facepunch.Steamworks.Utility.Epoch.FromDateTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Convert a DateTime to a unix time

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.GetPlayerList
member.summary:
Get a list of currently in-game clients on the specified gameserver. Please note: the playtime is stored as a float in seconds, you might want to convert it.
See https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Server_queries#A2S_PLAYER for more Information
member.returns: A PLayersResponse Object containing the name, score and playtime of each player

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.GetRules
member.summary:
Get a list of all publically available CVars ("rules") from the server. Note: Due to a bug in the Source Engine, it might happen that some CVars/values are cut off.
Example: mp_idlemaxtime = [nothing] Only Valve can fix that.
member.returns: A RulesResponse Object containing a Name-Value pair of each CVar

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.Dispose
member.summary: Close all currently open socket/UdpClient connections

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.GetSocket
member.summary: Open up a new Socket-based connection to a server, if not already open.

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.GetClient
member.summary: Create a new UdpClient connection to a server (mostly used for multi-packet answers)

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.ReassemblePacket(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Byte[]},System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reassmble a multi-packet response.
member.param: The packets to assemble
true: packets are compressed; false: not
The size of the message after decompression (for comparison)
Validation of the result
member.returns: A byte-array containing all packets assembled together/decompressed.

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.ReverseBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Invert the Byte-order Mark of an value, used for compatibility between Little Large BOM
member.param: The value to invert
member.returns: BOM-inversed value (if needed), otherwise the original value

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.PacketIsCompressed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determine whetever or not a message is compressed. Simply detects if the most significant bit is 1.
member.param: The value to check
member.returns: true, if message is compressed, false otherwise

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.PacketIsSplit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determine whetever or not a message is split up.
member.param: The value to check
member.returns: true, if message is split up, false otherwise

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.GetChallenge(System.Byte,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Request the 4-byte challenge id from the server, required for A2S_RULES and A2S_PLAYER.
member.param: The type of message to request the challenge for (see constants)
Request method to use (performance reasons)
member.returns: A Byte Array (4-bytes) containing the challenge

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.ReadByte
member.summary: Read a single byte value from our raw data.
member.returns: A single Byte at the next Offset Address

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.ReadBytes
member.summary: Read all remaining Bytes from our raw data. Used for multi-packet responses.
member.returns: All remaining data

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.ReadInt32
member.summary: Read a 32-Bit Integer value from the next offset address.
member.returns: The Int32 Value found at the offset address

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.ReadInt16
member.summary: Read a 16-Bit Integer (also called "short") value from the next offset address.
member.returns: The Int16 Value found at the offset address

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.ReadFloat
member.summary: Read a Float value from the next offset address.
member.returns: The Float Value found at the offset address

member.name: M:SourceServerQuery.ReadString
member.summary: Read a String until its end starting from the next offset address. Reading stops once the method detects a 0x00 Character at the next position (\0 terminator)
member.returns: The String read

member.name: M:SteamNative.Helpers.TakeStringBuilder
member.summary: Returns a StringBuilder. This will get returned and reused later on.

member.name: P:SteamNative.Platform.PackSmall
member.summary: We're only Pack = 8 on Windows
